maltemuth can't web

... but it shouldn't stay that way, so I started this github account and I'm already learning Jekyll!

The repository will contain code that I deemed "keep-worthy" and shouldn't be trusted to live on my hard-drive alone. The first example of this is show-when-checked, a jQuery-dependent snippet that I've rewritten 4 times before realising that I should just stow it away for later reuse.

But there must be a better way to do this, so feedback is very welcome.
